content: double_crochet r4 repeat row 2 crocodile stitch row r5 repeat row 3 foundation stitch row r6 repeat r2 cs row r7 repeat r3 r8 repeat r2 cs row r9 repeat r3 r10 repeat r2 cs row r11 repeat r3 r12 repeat r2 cs row -you should now have 6 row of crocodile stitch now is a good time to test the fit r13 ch3 and 2dc in same stitch *3dc in middle of scale 3 double_crochet in slip_stitch* repeat x4 chain 8 and skip the final crocodile stitch this creates the thumb hole slip_stitch to the first double_crochet not the starting chain to join 11 3dc chain 8 r14 slip_stitch to next space chain 3 double_crochet in same space *3 double_crochet in next space* repeat x8 in chain 8 space do 3dc ch1 3dc double_crochet in first space join with a slip_stitch to the top of the beginning ch3 12 3dc clusters © the yarnivore uk 2019 http //www yarnivore co uk no unauthorised reproduction in whole or in part or distribution of this pattern or content is allowed this pattern is the property of holly fisher the sole proprietor of the yarnivore uk v2 13/03/2019 r15 slip_stitch to next space ch3 double_crochet in same space 2dc in next space 3 double_crochet in next space *2dc in next 2 spaces 3 double_crochet in next* repeat x2 join with slip_stitch in top of ch3 8 2dc 4 3dc r16 slip_stitch to next space ch3 double_crochet in same space *2dc in next space* repeat x10 12 2dc r17 slip_stitch to next space ch3 double_crochet in same space skip next space 3dc in next 3 spaces skip next space 3dc in next 3 spaces skip next space 3dc in next 2 spaces 1dc in starting spacer join to top of ch3 9 3dc r18 25 slip_stitch to next space ch3 double_crochet in same stitch 3dc in each space around 1dc in starting space join to top of ch3 9 3dc to make gloves longer add more of these row r26 ch3 double_crochet in each stitch around join to top of ch3 r27 ch3 fpdc in 1st double_crochet bpdc in next stitch repeat pattern around to create ribbed edge the pattern and photographs contained in this
